channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for PA
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for PA

item.title: Report X-2023120460
item.description:
Report X-2023120460

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-12-06
  • City: BREINIGSVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package arrived at QA leaking, completely damaged. Items were placed in a yellow drum and stored in the Hazmat cage. DescribePack: Poor quality closure caused the caps to loosen and create spillage. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Items were placed in a yellow drum and stored in the Hazmat cage. Waiting on disposal.

Report E-2023120044

  • City: GREENCASTLE
  • State: PA

  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: While unloading freight from an outside carrier, material handler discovered a box that had fallen over in transit and consequently crushed and ruptured an inner 2.2L poly bottle inside. Spilled material was neutralized and cleaned with absorbent and placed into a recovery container as was the damaged carton and poly bottle.

item.title: Report X-2023120055
item.description:
Report X-2023120055

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-14T21:11:20+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-21
  • City: LEWISBERRY
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet and leaking upon inspection of inner contents 6 x 1 gallon metal cans of sunnyside acetone cleanup solvent. one 1 gallon metal can was bent dented causing lid to loosen and allowing .25 gallons to release no slotted partitions bags or absorbent was found. facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: one 1 gallon metal can was bent dented causing lid to loosen and allowing .25 gallons to release DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: leaking package was placed in a hazmat bag lined tote

item.title: Report X-2023120022
item.description:
Report X-2023120022

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T18:12:11+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-15
  • City: NEWVILLE
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Was called to unload to pick up. Upon investigation, we discovered that the sds was attached which listed that the contents were a combustible and flammable liquid. Was placed in hazmat bin and placed in the hazmat cage under the hood. DescribePack: dented, leaking from dent below the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Spill clean up was completed and was placed in hazmat bin and then taken to the cage

item.title: Report X-2023111249
item.description:
Report X-2023111249

  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was discovered on trailer number 814739 at 6:30 wet. Package was retrieved and taken out of system flow placed in a designated red tote. Upon inspection 2 x 1 Gallon cans of RMP26 Power Fill Plus had a loose lid and have leaked out resulting in both 1 gallon cans being damaged. DescribePack: 2 x 1 gallon cans had a loose lid and leaked out. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was removed from system flow and placed in a designated red tote.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package presented at station with a stain on 1 side of the box. Manager gave package to QA for inspection. DescribePack: Inner cap on 1 of the plastic bottles leaked. No hole's present, but there was a 6-inch stain on the outter package. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: QA took package and examined it, and tightened cap pf leaking bottle

item.title: Report X-2023110918
item.description:
Report X-2023110918

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-02
  • City: MIDDLETOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Shipment taken out of system flow due to external carton wet. Package came off of trailer#554777 already damaged/leaking. Upon inspection of inner contents 4 X 1 gallon plastic bottles Alpha 615-15 RMA FLUX. 1 X 1 gallon plastic bottle of RMA FLUX had a loose cap allowing .25 gallons to release damaging/soiling the other 3 X 1 gallon bottles. There were slotted partitions but no absorbent was found. Facility procedures for damaged hazardous materials followed. Contents contained and awaiting disposition. DescribePack: 1gal. plastic bottle of RMA FLUX had a loose cap leaking out .25 gallons of RMA FLUX soiling the other 3 bottles. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Package was placed inside a hazmat bag lined red tote.

item.title: Report X-2023110904

Report X-2023110904

  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA

  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: The steel drum was found on the hazmat pallet in QA. An admin from the previous sort informed us that it was leaking a little bit. Got my PPE to inspect the damage. Could not find any visible damage to the steel drum. DescribePack: There is a piece that is connected to the steel drum on top, a type of valve. It only leaks when the steel drum is not upright. DurationRel: 48 and MitigateEffect: Kept the steel drum upright to prevent any more leaks.

item.title: Report X-2023110724
item.description:
Report X-2023110724

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-08T18:13:14+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-11-01
  • City: EXTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: During our inbound sort this package was found to be wet/damp on one side of the box. Package placed into a damage tub and brought to the hazmat cage, where it was placed under our vented hood. DescribePack: Found that one of the bottles had a very loosed cap, resulting in internal leakage that was absorbed by the fiberboard box. No solution/spill was found. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Once the package was found during our inbound shift it was immediately addressed, placed into a sealed damage tub and moved to the hazmat cage.

item.title: Report X-2023120250
item.description:
Report X-2023120250

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-12T22:12:12+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-10-16
  • City: NORTHAMPTON
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: One of the admins has expressed concern over a damaged package to me. It has a strong odor of alcohol. I put on proper PPE to inspect the box and the contents. I used the pH test strip to determine what type of liquid was it since it's a clear liquid in a Milo's Sweet Tea container. It came out to a pH of 2. DescribePack: All of the caps were loose. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: It was kept upright and, in a tote, then transferred into a salvage drum.

Package was placed in yellow drum and secured in hazmat cage DescribePack: 1 of the gallon cleaners inside had a loose cap that lead to the leakage DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: package was secured in hazmat cage

item.title: Report I-2023060162
item.description:
Report I-2023060162

Identified by scraper @ 2023-12-13T00:34:03+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-23
  • City: JENKINTOWN
  • State: PA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: TruGreen
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While in transit, a TruGreen vehicle struck a guard pole at a fueling station. As a result of the impact, the hose connected to a vehicle-mounted, fiberglass tank was torn loose. The tank was carrying approximately 280 gallons of a solution of Fertilizer, Herbicide, Insecticide and Water, with water making up 98% of the solution. Approximately 280 gallons of free product was released to pavement and a storm drain at the loss location. Lewis Environmental was retained to perform the cleanup on site. The incident was reported to the National Response Center, the Pennsylvania Environmental Protection Agency, the Pennsylvania Emergency Management Agency, and the Montgomery County LEPC. No injuries or exposures were reported in connection with this incident.
